verb.description: Quickly seize (something) in a rude or eager way.
examples: she snatched a cookie from the plate
a victory snatched from the jaws of defeat

noun.description: An act of snatching or quickly seizing something.
The rapid raising of a weight from the floor to above the head in one movement.

origin: Middle English sna(c)che (verb) suddenly snap at, (noun) a snare; perhaps related to snack.
